page.title: 14MINING SUBSIDENCE-OUTWOOD
page.content: FOR OVER A CENTURY THIS HAS BEEN A COAL MINING AREA.IT IS HONEYCOMBED WITH GALLERIES,MANY UNCHARTED AND BARELY SUB SURFACE,AND DOTTED WITH DISUSED SLAG HEAPS,MOSTLY GRASSED OVER.THE LAST WORKING PIT WAS LOFTHOUSE,CLOSED IN 1982.SUBSIDENCE IS WIDESPREAD,CAUSING WALLS TO CRACK AND ROADS TO UNDULATE.TWELVE YEARS AGO THE SCHOOL DRIVE COLLAPSED INTO A GALLERY ONLY 2 METERS BELOW THE SURFACE. INTERNAL DOORS NEEDED REFITTING AND CRACKS APPEARED IN THE CORRIDOR.NEW HOUSES ARE BUILT ON A CONCRETE "RAFT" WHILE LOW-LYING LAND NEAR THE RIVER WHICH WAS SHEEP PASTURE LAST CENTURY IS NOW SWAMP.WHERE DAMAGE TO PROPERTY IS ATTRIBUTED TO MINING THE COST OF REPAIRS IS MET BY THE N.C.B. MINING IS NOT CARRIED OUT UNDER HISTORICAL SITES
